                                    The Bears have filed to trademark the phrase ‚ÄúVamos Bears,‚Äù which translates from Spanish to English as ‚Äúlet‚Äôs go Bears,‚Äù a popular chant by fans. 

    
        
            
    Sign Of The Times: The Chicago Bears have filed for the trademark to the phrase "Vamos Bears."
‚Äî Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) August 25, 2015





        

    


The Bears made the filing on July 21 with the following statement:

    
        
            Education and entertainment services in the nature of professional football games and exhibitions; providing sports and entertainment information via a global computer network or a commercial on-line computer service or by cable, satellite, television and radio; organizing football sporting and cultural events; fan club services; entertainment services, namely, fan clubs engaged in cheering, chanting, singing and other motivational activities for entertainment, amusement and recreation at professional football games, sports exhibitions, and other special events.


            
        

    



Bears offensive lineman Kyle Long likes the idea. 







    
    




According to ESPN‚Äôs Darren Rovell, the Bears aren‚Äôt the only NFL team looking to trademark phrases: 

    
        
            
    New trademarks registered by teams: Dolphins (Stronger Together), Patriots (We Are All Patriots), Falcons (Rise Up) & Seahawks (We Are 12)
‚Äî Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) August 25, 2015

        <div class="Page-twoColumn">
            <main class="Page-main" data-module data-padding="none" data-width="full-constrained">

                

                
                    <div class="ArticlePage-lede">

                <div class="Page-articleBody">
                    
                            

                            

                            
                                <div class="RichTextArticleBody RichTextBody">
                                    
                                        
                                    
                                    <p>The Bears <a class="Link" href="https://trademarks.justia.com/867/00/vamos-86700084.html" target="_blank" data-cms-ai="0">have filed</a> to trademark the phrase ‚ÄúVamos Bears,‚Äù which translates from Spanish to English as ‚Äúlet‚Äôs go Bears,‚Äù a popular chant by fans. </p>
<div class="Enhancement" data-align-center>
    <div class="Enhancement-item">
        <div class="ExternalContent-wrapper">
            <div class="TweetUrl">
    <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Sign Of The Times: The Chicago Bears have filed for the trademark to the phrase "Vamos Bears."</p>
‚Äî Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) <a href="https://twitter.com/darrenrovell/status/636155478813356032?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" data-cms-ai="0" target="_blank">August 25, 2015</a></blockquote>


</div>


        </div>

    </div>

</div>
<p>The Bears made the filing on July 21 with the following statement:</p>
<div class="Enhancement" data-align-center>
    <div class="Enhancement-item">
        <div class="BlockQuote">
            <blockquote><p>Education and entertainment services in the nature of professional football games and exhibitions; providing sports and entertainment information via a global computer network or a commercial on-line computer service or by cable, satellite, television and radio; organizing football sporting and cultural events; fan club services; entertainment services, namely, fan clubs engaged in cheering, chanting, singing and other motivational activities for entertainment, amusement and recreation at professional football games, sports exhibitions, and other special events.</p>
</blockquote>

            
        </div>

    </div>

</div>

<p>Bears offensive lineman Kyle Long likes the idea. </p>
<div class="RTEHashTagLabAdModule"><div class="HTLAds htlad-mobile_article_body_med_rec_dynamic" data-unit="/suntimes/chicago.suntimes.com/news" data-targeting="{}"></div>

</div>
<div class="RTEHashTagLabAdModule"><div class="HTLAds htlad-desktop_article_body" data-unit="/suntimes/chicago.suntimes.com/news" data-targeting="{}"></div>

</div>
<div class="Enhancement" data-align-center>
    <div class="HtmlModule">
    <iframe src="https://twitter.com/Ky1eLong/status/636158838425694209" allowfullscreen scrolling="no" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media"></iframe>
</div>


</div>
<p>According to ESPN‚Äôs Darren Rovell, the Bears aren‚Äôt the only NFL team looking to trademark phrases: </p>
<div class="Enhancement" data-align-center>
    <div class="Enhancement-item">
        <div class="ExternalContent-wrapper">
            <div class="TweetUrl">
    <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">New trademarks registered by teams: Dolphins (Stronger Together), Patriots (We Are All Patriots), Falcons (Rise Up) & Seahawks (We Are 12)</p>
‚Äî Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) <a href="https://twitter.com/darrenrovell/status/636166401007312896?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" data-cms-ai="0" target="_blank">August 25, 2015</a></blockquote>


</div>


        </div>

    </div>

</div>
<p></p>

                                </div>
